text: William Martin "Bill" Walker (born April 16, 1951) is an American attorney and politician. He was the 11th Governor of Alaska from December 1, 2014 to December 3, 2018. Walker ran for re-election in 2018 but three days after the resignation of Lieutenant Governor Byron Mallott, and having low polling numbers, he dropped out of the race on October 19 and supported Democrat Mark Begich. In August 2021, Walker announced his plans to run for governor again in the 2022 election. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:American Christians Category:American mayors Category:Governors of Alaska Category:Businesspeople from Alaska Category:Independent politicians in the United States Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Fairbanks, Alaska
title: Bill Walker (politician)
